findings.title: Integer underflow in run()
findings.explanation: In Solidity 0.4.23 arithmetic operations do not check for underflow. The run(uint256 input) function subtracts the untrusted `input` from `count` without bounds checking. If `input` > `count` (which starts at 1), `count` underflows to a very large value. An attacker can call init() (no access control) and then run() with a value greater than 1 to trigger the underflow.
